Description:
Fabulous Family Home & Shedding To Please Tradesperson
This sweet Victorian has more than meets the eye. The home with a 20 year old extension now offers four bedrooms, a vast living room and a sunny kitchen. The kitchen is also large and extremely functional with great bench space, while being open plan to the lounge. A perfect entertainer your guest can flow from big living out to the paved pergola area. A car collector or tradesperson will be delighted by the amazing car coverage. The abode sits in a generous allotment in a quiet street just two minutes from the hub of town.

Description:
Contemporary Elegance
A saw tooth roofline, two tone exterior and a slight elevation for superior interest create a smart, contemporary facade to this cosy Creswick home. Constructed of hardiplank and colourbond and positioned along Andrew Street, this fabulous three bedroom home offers up to date dcor, open design and neutral palette.
A sweeping concreted driveway provides a softened formation to the bordering garden and lawns, while the double lock up garage is easily accessed from the flowing direction. Set on a fabulous 981m2 allotment, with established shrubs and connected water tank, this low maintenance property offers an undercover portico along with a slightly raised tiled area to dine outdoors.
Internally the home is highlighted by the appealing straight grain and the red brown undertone of the natural flooded gum timber floors, whilst the double blinds, decorative cornice and colour palette add a further warmth and style. The formal lounge boasts further timber floors and offers a quiet spot to relax away from the hub of the home. The kitchen is an open design to the family area and offers a clean palette of greys and whites, with stainless appliances, a double door pantry and recessed fridge area.
All bedrooms offer built in robes with the master suite incorporating a handy ensuite and walk in robes. The family bathroom offers a 900mm shower, a modern vanity, ducted heating vent along with a separate toilet and vanity for additional powder room convenience. The independent laundry offers a good size bench for folding clothes, pull out laundry basket, broom cupboard and plenty of overhead storage for those extra bits. Central heating comforts the entire home whilst a strategically placed split system directs additional temperature through the family area and kitchen, which also benefit from a North Easterly aspect.
Built by Merritt Constructions approx. 4 years ago, this property offers a near new design and condition. With walking distance to school bus pick up and Doug Lindsay Reserve, this property provides a plethora of further facilities and amenities close at hand. This home will not last long on the Creswick market, call today for further details and inspection times.
Insights: 15 Andrew Street, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2020 and 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Description:
Quaint Cottage and Rolling Hills
First time advertised in nearly 70 years, this sweet, relaxed miners' cottage has been uplifted over the years to now present a well-proportioned two bedroom home for someone else to love. Presented with a new approx. 8 x 10m colourbond shed with remote, power, bench space and concrete floors, a shearing shed with holding yards and plunge dip, a wood & tall hay shed, plus a machinery shed with various bays to hold either a boat, a caravan or just store further farming equipment and 2 single garages, this will house all of your farm equipment and machinery.
Sitting on two titles equalling approximately 15 acres, and divided into three paddocks, this property would be ideal for hobby farmers, horse enthusiasts or perfect for those looking at running a number of stock. Neighbouring crown land with seasonal creek is also leased annually at a minimal cost per year if purchasers are interested in having a little more ground.
Whilst miners' cottages are not expansive, there is a delightful full width veranda ready to soak up the morning sunshine, while the interior offers two bedrooms with freestanding robes and a generous bathroom with a 900mm shower recess with hip bath and a huge linen cupboard. The living area and kitchen have been updated through the 80's to provide a welcoming light filled space with a split system and freestanding wood heater assisting the overall comfort of these rooms. A walk in pantry, fridge cavity and plenty of bench space surround a central dining table, which also provides a cosy country feel when dining formally or casually. Recently painted along with a new hot water service, this home is truly presented with a neat simple feel, which would make anyone smile from ear to ear.
Further features include school bus pick up along the Creswick-Newstead road, town water, tank water storage, solar panels available for connection along with a studio or cubby house ready for your imagination. Broomfield is just 5 minutes from the buzzing little township of Creswick along with just 20 minutes to the centre of Ballarat city via the Midland Highway. Call our agent today for further details of this cute home, handy sheds and usable acreage.
Insights: 38 Graham Road, Broomfield VIC 3364 was last sold in 2019.

Description:
Luxurious Home On 7+ Acres
In a most secluded and idyllic location and close to the conveniences of Creswick township, this beautiful country property reveals a spectacular floor plan that achieves a remarkable use of space and proportion.
Most brilliantly exhibited by the cathedral ceilings through the family room and enhanced by the sophisticated polished floors throughout, this home is filled with loads of natural light from the many windows and doors. The study is currently set as a home gymnasium yet this area provides an opportunity to set up a home business with an external door giving an independent entry.
The kitchen is located centrally and displays quality appliances including: a Belling black cooker, further stainless appliances along with a very popular walk in pantry. The entire home is warmed by two wood heaters with a split system adding to the ambient temperature and comfort of the home.
The master bedroom is a retreat on its own, with a luxurious corner spa and fabulous walk in robes, also with access through to the study, making it perfect not only as a home office, but also a potential nursery, while the three minor bedrooms are serviced by the fresh clean family bathroom and independent laundry.
Entertaining outdoors will also provide the ultimate dining experience, with a large front deck that takes in views across the district and approx. 7 acres (3.14ha) on offer.
Beautiful scattered gums, prolific fruit trees and pinot and chardonnay grapes add to the beautification of this stunning property.
Cattle yards are presented with well fenced grazing paddocks along with three dams, chicken coup, and a shipping container for extra storage. Town water is connected, with a handy school bus stop close by.
Located on the outskirts of the gorgeous township of Creswick with easy commuting options to Ballarat, Daylesford and Melbourne.
Be quick, call our agents for further details and inspection times.

Description:
Perfect Weekender or First Home Buyer on approx 5 Acres
This little gem is located only a few minutes from the centre of Talbot and is perfect for a weekend getaway. This property has the best of both worlds with the area around this 2 bedroom home cleared for easy maintenance and the remaining bush taking care of itself. No need to worry about fire wood as the property already has a stack ready for use while having access to plenty on the land. The huge open plan kitchen/dining includes a wood stove as well as a small electric bench top oven with hotplates. The rumpus room or second living room has also been used as extra sleeping quarters.
Property also includes town water, 2 dams, 2 large water tanks, excellent shedding with undercover car parking for 6 cars and bbq area.
For more information please contact AAG Property Consultants on 5345 3533

Description:
Character filled home, close to conveniences!
Located a stone's throw from the Creswick train station, walking distance to the Creswick town amenities and only 5 minute's walk to 2 schools is the character filled home. This period home is in good condition for its age and offers buyers a chance to simply move in. There are four spacious bedrooms (1 could be another living area if required), and a spacious open plan styled living area. The timber kitchen offers ample storage space, electric cooking, and timber flooring. The large bathroom also incorporates the laundry amenities. Outside the property is fully fenced, has off street parking with access via the rear of the property, and a generous land size of approx. 1000sqm. With established gardens, recently re-painted interior, gas wall heater and NBN connection, this is a great value for money property.
Phil Hayward : 0419 107 112

Description:
Super Cute Beautifully Renovated Victorian
This Victorian beauty offers a rare opportunity to purchase a slice of Creswick's living history. Having undergone significant renovations, there is no better time to secure this stunning home that retains it's original feel whilst encompassing all the modern conveniences you would hope for.
Behind the beautiful weatherboard faade you will find a four bedroom home packed with 21st century features. The open plan offers balanced proportions with light pouring through the floor to ceiling windows and reflecting off the warm white palette and high gloss cabinetry. The designer kitchen features a handy island bench and ample soft closing drawers and cupboards, premium appliances along with stylish timber laminate floors for complete durability.
The living room features a cosy gas log fire. Each of the four bedrooms provide built in robes and double blinds with the master offering mirrored robes to reflect the generous size of the room, the 4th bedroom or study also features stack stone feature wall, possibly with the opportunity to re-open the original fireplace if required. The bathroom has been successfully combined with the laundry amenities, which also provides extra room in the more important living zones.
Outside features include a slightly raised full covered outdoor entertaining deck which is the perfect space to enjoy with family and friends, while a single lock up garage and workshop are tucked to the corner of the fully enclosed yard which is ideal to complete the landscaping opportunities. Topping off this charming property, is its proximity benefits. Across the road from one of the local primary schools and kinder, and just two blocks to connect with the bus service to secondary education, this property also profits from a short walk to the railway station, bus stop, supermarket, hotel and gourmet shopping strip that is Creswick's thriving main street.
Creswick provides excellent medical facilities and amenities along with great connection to the Western Freeway if commuting to Melbourne and beyond. Virtually positioned to the middle of Ballarat and Daylesford where entertainment, further schooling and the arts can be further reached with ease. Call our agent today for extra details and inspection times of this real estate beauty.

Description:
A Polished Family Home, In A Quiet Courts & Amazing Shedding
Built in 1999 this attractive family abode has something for everyone. The home has terrific room sizes with gracious living rooms and large bedrooms that will take your big suites. There is an ensuite to the master bedroom along with a WIR. A study could also be an optional fourth bedroom. A functional kitchen is also generous in proportions and has stainless steel appliance, pantry and fabulous bench space. Approaching winter, the gas central heating will be appreciated. The yard is huge and the kids and pets will adore it. The bigger kids may enjoy the amazing car coverage with garage joined to the home and a separate 6x14.5m shed with tall door to take the caravan. All this just two minutes to the hub of town, while being on the Ballarat side for a quick leave to Melbourne.

WELL PRESENTED BRICK HOME, CLOSE TO MAIN STREET OF CRESWICK
Located walking distance to the main street of Creswick, school, shops and cafes is this low maintenance three bedroom family home. Inside you will discover three good sized bedrooms with built in robes, a well presented kitchen with electric stove, good sized main living area with an excellent Rinnai heater and bathroom with separate bath and shower. As a bonus on the 620m2 block is a single carport plus the benefit of rear access to the spacious backyard, perfect for the kids plus, a double garage and gazebo and close to the local footy oval.

Description:
As-New House in a Rural Setting on 5093m2, with current P/P to Subdivide
Within walking distance of the Creswick township, this J.G.King home is in immaculate condition.
A feature of this property is a current Planning Permit to subdivide the block into a 2 Lot subdivision. On completion of the subdivision the vacant lot could be developed or sold separately.
The total, 1.25acres (approx) block features cleared areas and established trees making this an ideal Back to Nature property in a secluded location.
The house features all services; 3 bedrooms (ensuite and WIR to master); spacious open plan kitchen/dining/living area; separate lounge; modern kitchen with gas hotplates, electric oven and dishwasher; solar HWS; ducted gas heating; solid fuel heater in the living area and an outdoor entertaining area overlooking the land and local wildlife.The double garage has an electric door and provides direct internal access.

Description:
Position Perfect in Creswick
Sometime convenience is just another word, but in this case you couldn't ask for any better. Situated virtually across the road from the Creswick North Primary school and a quick minute's drive to the buzzing centre of Creswick, this home will certainly tantalize a young family or those looking for minimal upkeep.
With renovations completed though the kitchen and dining area, and with wide hallways, picture rails and high ceilings still in place, this property certainly provides many period features and the perfect opportunity to further add your dcor or renovating stamp. Three bedrooms, sunlight study, an enclosed side veranda or sunroom, a formal lounge and open plan kitchen and meals area create a family friendly floorplan for those looking at living and/or working in the friendly community of Creswick.
Finished with stainless steel appliances, a central island bench and a free standing combustion heater, this kitchen also offers an original fireplace and chimney which could be uncovered for further warmth or for another dcor focal point. Underfloor central heating also provides overall warmth to the entire home which is fuelled and serviced by natural gas. A European style laundry, family bathroom and ample cabinetry cover all the hygiene necessities and provide excellent storage options.
A further bonus of this 621m2 allotment is the massive shed which incorporates six car bays, concrete and power and a mechanical pit for that little extra benefit if you are looking at running your own business from your home (STCA). An easy care yard adds a further advantage to this unique package which also provides full colourbond fencing, lawns and a clean canvas ready for your landscaping talent. A very functional home with a cosy homely feel throughout, - don't be deceived by the faade, it is bigger and better than you think.
Creswick provides every possible amenity and facility along with nearby connection with Ballarat and/or Melbourne via the Midland and Western Freeways. Call our agent today for further details and inspection times.

Description:
Retire, Begin or Downsize
Positioned at the entrance of a very neat and tidy complex of brick veneer units, and the first time marketed in nearly three decades, this unit is ready for the next investor.
Ideally situated just minutes from the bustling street of Creswick; easy connection to the Midland Highway and within walking distance to Main St , this property will delight anyone looking for a simple floorplan with room to future improve for additional capital growth.
This welcoming home incorporates two good size bedrooms with built in robes, a convenient family bathroom with separate toilet, along with a defined dining area, lounge and open plan kitchen.
Finished with cosy carpet, striking laminate flooring and feature tiles, this home provides retirees, first home buyers, investors or those looking to downsize an opportunity to add your own style and creativity.
Comforted by ducted central heating with further conveniences via a split system, this home already presents with a warm inviting space with loads of natural light streaming through.
The fully enclosed back yard is lined with manicured box hedges, concrete paths and lawns, side access to the rear of the yard , while the single lock up garage to the front incorporates plenty of space to park and turn with ease.
Presented with external sunblinds to the front and back, along with a sweet elevated veranda for welcoming guests.
Connected to natural gas and offering NBN advantages, this property will certainly provide you with a fabulous investment
Call our agent for further details and inspection times.

Description:
Creswick Townhouse With Surprising Large Allotment
This surprisingly spacious townhouse has great proportions both inside and out. Both the bedrooms have room for your larger suites and the open plan kitchen, meal and lounge is also vast and north facing capturing great natural light. There is an outdoor entertaining area (decking) for all to enjoy and even yard space for kids or pets. The home is backs onto a reserve.

Description:
Prized Acreage on Outskirts of Creswick
This ideal slice of land provides all the comfort of country living yet offers the nearby convenience of the buzzing township of Creswick. An ideal hobby farm, or the perfect building site, this well fenced 10 acres of land is just waiting for those wishing build, farm or just invest. With power to a pole near the proposed building site and a planning permit in place, this private setting offers a water bore, small shed and a back drop of scattered trees to tempt the tastebuds. Separated into two well fenced paddocks, one is cleared and the other with light to medium tree coverage with a lovely clearing for the proposed home site - which is close to the shed, bore (unlimited) and kids play area. This is not quite finished, but wouldn't take much to get it up and going! With access to unlimited water (which is not something you can pay to set up any more), the world is your oyster. Irrigate if you choose to improve your pasture, water your stock without concern, or even hook it up to the house if you prefer.
This generous allotment is ideal for a new build, with many other new neighbouring properties taking advantage of its position and commuting simplicity. Located just 20 minutes north of Ballarat in the Shire of Hepburn, this land is definitely a tantalising opportunity for farmers to downsize or ideal for a much needed tree change. If you are looking for a little land for those much loved pets, then this property is definitely worth a drive by. Come on, make your next move, call our agents today, to find out further details and conditions of this great buy.

Description:
One of the Best in Creswick
There is always something truly warm about a sandstone home, whether it is the creamy tones or the texture of the brick; it seems like a solid beach with waves embedded in its structure. Top this homely construction with a colorbond roof, a decorative veranda and place it on a corner allotment of 2539m2 and you have a home with warmth, character and room to move. Movement is what this home is all about. Not only does this package offer space inside, it also begins with a three bay garage for the family vehicles and an additional double garage for further machinery or boy's toys. Entertaining outdoors will definitely not be inhibited, as there is an extensive paved alfresco zone that ensures your dining experience is well protected. Oh and did I mention a salt chlorinated in-ground swimming pool? Imagine those summer evenings around it or even during the cooler weather as it is heated via passive solar from the roof.
Take a walk inside and cast your eye over the liberal floorplan: four bedrooms include an oversized master with luxury ensuite and walk in robe, whilst the three minor bedrooms are complimented by a further study or fifth bedroom, family bathroom with spa and a convenient laundry. A large meals area encased in a sunlit bay window contributes to the living space, which blends perfectly with the open plan kitchen and casual living zone. With stainless steel appliances and a full four person breakfast bar and large walk in pantry, this area is a welcoming hub to an already warm and cosy home. The formal lounge offers a mantled 2 way combustion fire plus ducted central heating for further warmth and convenience and is designed to offer a formal dining area for those more significant dinner parties. The polished timber floors in the family area and games room have been trimmed with detailed etchings that create an interesting and designated zone for family and friends. Three split systems also provide additional temperature control in these entertaining areas as well.
When you're looking for a home that has the ability to entertain family and friends with real style, then this stunning 36 square home has been crafted with that in mind. Situated opposite bushland and offering a uniquely private and country style setting this property is without doubt one of Creswick's finest family homes. Ensure you call our agents for further information and inspection times today.

Description:
Tourello - 7kms Clunes - 30kms Ballarat
7.5 Acre Farmlet with Farm Infrastructure
Vendors are moving to township living and offer a comfortable lifestyle package. Home comprises 3BRs, kitchen/dining, lounge, bathroom and laundry and could be updated and will respond to refurbishment. Outside is former separator room, double garage, all steel hay shed and shearing shed. Property is in two main paddocks with shelter belt and fertile soil. Bore water is available for livestock and garden.
Price around $250,000.00

Description:
Kinross Homestead - Period Home on 20 Acres
Situated in Springmount, within 15 minutes drive of Daylesford and built around 1910, Kinross Homestead, is one of the region's original farm houses.
Retaining its original character & charm, including a wide front verandah & hallway, Kinross features 3 large bedrooms, 2 living rooms, a country-style kitchen with adjoining dining room & a spa bathroom.
A generous scullery / larder abutts the kitchen & all rooms offer garden views.
Currently used for horses, the well-maintained 20acres is divided into 9 paddocks each with water access pumped from the large dam, with the house accessing town water.
Ample shedding includes an old dairy with yards, a hay-shed, stables & a chook-house.
The established gardens offer mature fruit trees, a vegetable garden & a private courtyard with direct house access, while Claret Ash, Silver Birch
& large majestic weeping Elm offer summer shade.
Kinross is located 5 minutes from Creswick, with access to riding trails & the Goldfields Walking Track at the rear of the property.
Well situated to Ballarat, with Melbourne just 90 minutes away on the Western Freeway.
Inspect by appointment
Mark Smith : 0439 321 566

Description:
Cosy and whimsical
Located on approximately 5 acres, in a much sort after location approximately 15 minutes from Ballarat and 4 minutes to Creswick, this cosy 2 bedroom home is complimented by a myriad of shedding, is fully fenced with an enclosed picket fence house yard. The Bryan and Peterson home is in original condition and situated well back in the block .The house has two separate living areas and two bedrooms, separate toilet, bath and laundry. The dado walls compliment this solid period home.
The kitchen is all electric and has a substantial walk in pantry. The house was constructed in the late 1980's and is complimented by an established garden area. This tranquil environment has a north facing porch and a shady backyard for your outdoor needs.
The double lock up garage has remote access, power and workbench.
Tony Mullins : 0422630516

Description:
Handsome Home On Private Acreage In Historic Kingston
This private limestone abode was constructed in the mid 80's on a mostly clear 5.25 acres. The home is set back from the road and hidden by a well-established row of trees. The residence has a true sense of warmth with wondrous timber features throughout. The two bedroom home has polished 1.25 inch jarrah floorboards, a cathedral style ceiling with Cyprus exposed beams and a $7,500 Wamster upright combustion oven. Rare for its locale the home has town water. Kingston with its beautiful tree lined streets is just 5 minutes to Creswick and 15minutes to Daylesford. A wonderful home or an ideal week-ender.

Description:
Brand New Quality Home On 2000 sqrm
Have you been looking for an affordable brand new home with all the benefits of Country Living? Then this may be just what you are after. This G J Gardner 22+sq home has just been finished to a high standard. Boasting 3 bedrooms and study, master with WIR and ensuite with BIR's in the remaining bedrooms. Open plan kitchen living/dining as well as separate lounge. Attached double garage and concrete driveway. Keep comfortable all year round with electric ducted heating and cooling. Outside there is nothing left to do with all the fencing completed, formal entry to the property as well as instant turf laid. You can also relax and unwind in the outdoor entertaining area that captures the great country vistas. This is a great opportunity to live the country life without all the hard work. Only a short drive from Ballarat and just 6 minutes to Creswick. Be sure to call today to find out more.

Description:
What an opportunity!
Often sought but seldom found, a modern elevated home just an easy stroll to the beautiful gourmet strip within the township of Creswick. Take in peaceful views & stunning sunsets from this contemporary classic.
* In close proximity to both Daylesford & Ballarat town centres, enjoy the best of both worlds
* Spacious open plan living & dining flow through to an outer deck, ideal for entertaining
* Central sparkling bathroom
* Enjoy year round comfort with ducted heating
* Spacious 764sqm approx. allotment with 2 street frontages gives room to further transform STCA
* The gardens are a blank canvas, ready for you to make your very own
*St Georges Lake & walks all an easy amble away & monthly farmers market is a highlight for serious foodies
